taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section hispidi;species hispidus;variety obovalis;

treatment.description: More slender; canes weaker, mostly 1-2 mm. in diameter, quite smooth or with 1-200 bristles per dm.; -petioles of primocane-foliage smooth or with 1- rarely 100 bristles; terminal leaflet 1.5-4.5 cm. long, 1-3.5 cm. broad.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: More often in damp habitats, Que. to Wisc., s. to N.S., N.E., L.I., N.C., O., Ind. and Ill.
